page.title: 02FARMING IN WEST LEOMINSTER
page.content: Farming is the principal activity in the area and consists of rough pasture, arable land and orchards. The arable crops consist of wheat, maize, oil-seed rape, hops, sugar beet, potatoes and other vegetables and soft fruit. Pastureland supports dairy herds, beef cattle and sheep.Some of the original Hereford herds have been crossed with imported Charollais bulls. Dairy herds are mostly Friesian. There is a race-horse training establishment and also a large intensive turkey production unit. Pheasants are also bred here for shooting. The orchards are mainly of cider apples and perry pears, which are contract grown for local cider makers (some of the largest in the country).
